title: [UI Bug] Persistent REPL exception toast errors
description:
## Symptom
Toast showing 'REPL Invoke Exception Error: No protocol m...' with incrementing badge count

## Behavior
- Persists across all screens
- Obscures voice buttons on Conversation screen
- Badge count increments over time

## Likely Cause
ClojureScript protocol errors bubbling up to error toast system

title: [UI Bug] DirectoryList session count not displayed - clj->js key conversion issue
description:
## Steps to Reproduce
1. Open the app
2. View the Projects (DirectoryList) screen
3. Observe each directory item shows 'sessions' without a number

## Expected Behavior
Each directory item should show the session count, e.g., '3 sessions' or '1 session'

## Actual Behavior
Each directory item just shows 'sessions' with no count

## Screenshot
/tmp/test-screenshot-1.png

## Root Cause
In directory_list.cljs, the render-item function uses:
```clojure
:session-count (.-sessionCount item)
```

But `clj->js` converts `{:session-count 5}` to JavaScript object with key `"session-count"` (preserves kebab-case as string), NOT `sessionCount`.

## Fix
Change the property access from:
```clojure
:session-count (.-sessionCount item)
:last-modified (.-lastModified item)
```
to:
```clojure
:session-count (aget item "session-count")
:last-modified (aget item "last-modified")
```

Or use `:keywordize-keys` option when converting.

## Additional Context
- File: frontend/src/voice_code/views/directory_list.cljs
- Function: directory-list-view, render-item callback
- Same issue likely affects last-modified display

title: Phase 6: Initialize Native iOS/Android Projects
description:
Initialize native iOS and Android projects for React Native.

Requirements:
- Create native projects using react-native init
- Configure iOS project in frontend/ios/
- Configure Android project in frontend/android/
- Install and link native dependencies
- Install CocoaPods for iOS
- Configure shadow-cljs hot reload with Metro bundler

Testing:
- App builds and runs on iOS simulator
- App builds and runs on Android emulator
- shadow-cljs REPL connects to running app
